intro: Navicularia scardica, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Navicularia scardica is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
